To create an offline or local profile in Games for Windows Live, proceed as follows:

Launch Street Fighter X Tekken-SKIDROW.
Press the "Home" button on the keyboard to bring up the Games for Windows Live menu.
If you have already signed in, you must first click the "Sign out" button in the menu and confirm.
In the menu, click on the button to "Create New Profile."
In the next window, scroll down to the bottom of the page and click "Create a Local Profile".
In the Offline Gamer Profile window, enter the name for the profile you would like to create.  
Once the profile has been created, click "Done" to sign into the profile.
Press the "Home" button on the keyboard to return to the game and play using the offline profile.

Well guys, i have found out how to unlock 3rd alt costumes for some of the chars. first off, you need to get 

****//www.mediafire.***/download.php?fv2svpyowwc0865 

(replace stars with obvious)

this is the costume changer programme. just open it with winrar and drop it all into your install dir. 

next you need to go here. 

***sfxtmods.pbworks.***/w/page/53661567/360%20ports

(replace stars with the obvious)

this is where you download the outfits. what ya need to do here is download the character of your choice then go to

 C:Program Files (x86)CapcomStreet Fighter X TekkenresourceCMNbattle

now just drag the files ( not the folder name but all the files inside that folder) into that char folder. 

EG. nin, ogr ken. 

so once you have the outfits installed in there char folders, go ahead and open the costume changer programme. now, select the char from the drop down list and select cost 1 2 or 3. then hit the middle button to the right ( its in chinese so its the middle one you want) 

thats it!! your new costume is done. 

any questions just ask here ok. thanks in advance guys/ladies.

For those of you that don't have DVD's or just don't want to use one for this, just download Virtual Clone Drive (or a program like it depending on what you prefer) and it'll read the ISO as if you put a disk into the disk drive. This is a fix for the x0ffffff error, no probs:

1: Make sure Windows update service is running, this is very important!

2: Install GfWL - or just install 'Windows Live ID Sign-in Assistant 6.5', if you already have GfWL installed.

3: Delete any 'xlive.dll' you may have downloaded and put into the game folder.

4: Reset if required, then play the game. Also, EASY. :p
